name: Milan Cathedral
description: One of the largest cathedrals in the world, this iconic masterpiece took over 600 years to complete.

name: Sforza Castle
description: Huge Medieval-Renaissance fortress with historical museums & art by da Vinci and Michelangelo.

name: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II
description: Mall housed in a glass-covered 19th-century arcade with luxury clothing brands & upscale dining.

name: Teatro alla Scala
tagline: Grand opera house for Italian classics
description: Lavish, 18th-century theater, famous for Italian opera & ballets, with a museum & music library.

name: Santa Maria delle Grazie
tagline: Church with Da Vinci's The Last Supper
description: Terracotta Renaissance church with elaborate Gothic interior, home to Da Vinci's The Last Supper.

name: Pinacoteca di Brera
tagline: Art museum specialising in Italian art
description: Graceful palazzo used by Napoleon, with medieval and Renaissance art especially from Northern Italy.

name: Parco Sempione
description: Park & gardens landscaped by Emilio Alemagna, with a tower, aquarium, theater & municipal library.

name: Piazza del Duomo, Milan
description: Piazza del Duomo is the main piazza of Milan, Italy. It is named after, and dominated by, the Milan Cathedral. The piazza marks the center of the city, both in a geographic sense and because

name: Via Monte Napoleone
description: Via Monte Napoleone, also spelled Via Montenapoleone, is an upscale shopping street in Milan, Italy. Via Montenapoleone is Europe's most expensive street. It is famous for its ready-to-wear fashion

name: Central Station area
description: Milano Centrale is a district of Milan, Italy, part of the Zone 2 administrative division of the city, located north-east from the centre. It is named after the Milano Centrale railway station.

name: Cimitero Monumentale di Milano
description: Cemetery known for its funerary sculpture in differing styles, some by famous artists/architects.

name: Basilica di Sant'Ambrogio
description: Romanesque church with an elegant courtyard, plus a crypt where St Ambrose's remains are displayed.

name: Porta Sempione
description: Triumphal arch with bas-reliefs & statues, built by Luigi Cagnola on the request of Napoleon.

name: Biblioteca Ambrosiana
description: Renowned art gallery housing a collection of Da Vinci drawings, plus works by Caravaggio & Titian.

name: Naviglio Grande
description: The Naviglio Grande is a canal in Lombardy, northern Italy, joining the Ticino river near Tornavento to the Porta Ticinese dock, also known as the Darsena, in Milan. It drops 34 m over 49.9 km

name: Museo Teatrale alla Scala
tagline: Opera museum inside the famed hall
description: Museum showcasing costumes, portraits & musical instruments from the famed La Scala opera house.

name: Basilica di San Lorenzo, Milano
description: Imposing early-Christian church housing an octagonal chapel decorated with 5th-century mosaics.

name: Museo Nazionale Scienza e Tecnologia Leonardo da Vinci
tagline: Science museum for da Vinci scale models
description: Former monastery housing science museum with scale models of da Vinci's submarines & planes.

name: San Maurizio al Monastero Maggiore
tagline: Church known for its frescoes & artwork
description: Historic 16th-century church & former monastery with vivid biblical-themed artwork & frescoes.

name: Triennale
description: Museum with permanent & temporary design-related exhibits on themes from architecture to furniture.

name: Piazza Mercanti
description: Outdoor exhibitions, markets & concerts often take place in this medieval public square.

name: Santa Maria presso San Satiro
description: Elegant church dating from the 15th century, with regular services & an ornate gilded interior.

name: Colonne di San Lorenzo
tagline: Ancient Roman ruin with marble columns
description: Archeological site made up of 16 Roman marble columns, next to remains of an amphitheater and baths.

name: Via della Spiga
description: Via della Spiga is one of the Italian city of Milan's top shopping streets, forming the north-east boundary of the luxurious Quadrilatero della Moda, along with Via Monte Napoleone, Via Manzoni

name: Bosco Verticale
description: Trees, shrubs, perennials & ground cover line the facade of these 2 residential towers.

name: Via Manzoni
description: Via Manzoni is a busy and fashionable street in the Italian city of Milan which leads from the Piazza della Scala north-west towards Piazza Cavour. Notable buildings include the Museo Poldi Pezzoli

name: Quadrilatero della moda
description: The Quadrilatero della Moda, or Quad d’Oro, is an upscale shopping area in the Centro Storico district. The main drag, Via Monte Napoleone, is lined with designer fashion boutiques, antiques

name: Museo Poldi Pezzoli
description: Elegant museum containing an extensive collection of Italian art & paintings by the Flemish masters.

name: Corso Buenos Aires
description: Corso Buenos Aires is a major street in north-eastern Milan, Italy. With over 350 shops and outlets, it features the highest concentration of clothing stores in Europe. The architecture of the

name: San Bernardino alle Ossa
tagline: Historic church with a human bone chapel
description: This 13th-century Catholic church includes an ossuary with frescoes lined with human skulls & bones.

name: Torre Branca
tagline: Steel tower with sweeping city views
description: Steel tower built for 1933 Triennale. Stairs & an elevator climb to 109m for panoramic city views.

name: Giardini Pubblici Indro Montanelli
description: 18th-century public gardens, home to the Natural History Museum, Palazzo Dugnani & planetarium.

name: Civic Aquarium of Milan
description: Family attraction with native & global aquatic flora & fauna as well as a marine biology library.

name: Museo Civico di Storia Naturale di Milano
description: 19th-century building with displays of minerals, fossils, skeletons & preserved animals.

name: Basilica of Sant'Eustorgio
tagline: Grand Catholic church with a museum
description: Old, Romanesque-style Catholic church with historic paintings & an attached museum.

name: Galleria d'Arte Moderna, Milan
description: Grandiose, 18th-century mansion exhibiting Italian art & sculptors, plus works by Cezanne & Gauguin.

name: Bagatti Valsecchi Museum
description: 16th-century townhouse with a sumptuous interior, housing Renaissance decorative arts & paintings.

name: Orto Botanico di Brera
description: Tranquil garden established in 1774 with flowerbeds, ponds & an arboretum with centuries-old trees.

name: Palazzo della Ragione, Milan
description: 13th-century medieval palace decorated with astrological frescoes, now used for exhibitions.

name: Villa Belgiojoso Bonaparte
description: The Villa Belgiojoso Bonaparte, also known as Villa Reale and formerly called Villa Comunale, is a palace in Milan, in Lombardy in northern Italy. It was built between 1790 and 1796 as the residence

name: Villa Necchi Campiglio
description: Museum consisting of an architect-designed villa with decorative arts, paintings & period furniture.

name: Museo d'Arte Antica
description: The Museo d'Arte Antica is an art museum in the Castello Sforzesco of Milan, in Lombardy in northern Italy. It has a large collection of sculpture from the late antiquity, Mediaeval and Renaissance

name: Idroscalo
description: The Idroscalo is an artificial lake in Milan, Italy that was originally constructed as a seaplane airport. It opened on 28 October 1930, in the heyday of seaplanes. When the use of seaplanes

name: Scala
tagline: La Scala opera house & upmarket dining
description: Part of the wider Centro Storico area, Scala is known for its famous opera and ballet venue, the 18th-century, neoclassical Teatro alla Scala, with its gilded auditorium. The adjoining Museo

name: Piazza Cordusio
description: Piazza Cordusio is a square in central Milan, Italy. The piazza takes its name from the Cors Ducis which was found in the square during Longobard times. It is well known for its several turn-

name: Archaeological Museum
description: Museum of ancient Greek, Etruscan, Roman & Indian artifacts in an ex-convent with medieval frescoes.

name: Royal Villa of Monza
description: Grand neo-classical estate with royal apartments, a chapel, park and gardens, plus guided tours.

name: Torre Velasca
description: Iconic 1950s skyscraper with a mushroom-like shape featuring shops, offices & private apartments.

name: San Fedele
description:
San Fedele is a Jesuit church in Milan, northern Italy. It is entitled to St. Fidelis of Como, patron of the Catholic diocese of Como.
Located in Saint Fedele Square in the centre of the city
